channel.title: The Spy/The Informant [BD/Unseen]
channel.description:
> ## [color=steblue]The Spy[/color] > **[color=steblue]Blue Dragon Investigative[/color]** **Watchful Eyes (Day)** - The name of the next player who uses a day ability will be revealed to you. (3 uses) **Snoop (Night)** - Spy on a player's journal. (1 use) **Gather Information (Night)** - Choose a player. Receive all notifications that player receives tonight, aside from the results of their own abilities. *BD victory condition.*
> ## [color=purple]The Informant[/color] > **[color=purple]Unseen Investigative[/color]** **Watchful Eyes (Day)** - The name of the next player who uses a day ability will be revealed to you. Ignores abilities of the Unseen. (3 uses) **Snoop (Night)** - Spy on a player's journal. (1 use) **Gather Information (Night)** - Choose a player. Receive all notifications that player receives tonight, aside from the results of their own abilities. *Unseen victory condition.*
Thoughts?
Changelog:
-Changed the number of Snoop uses from 2 to 1

item.description:
The thing is, I did ask around before posting this class. It appears everyone thought that if it gave the night result of the person targeted, it would be way too strong. So, I limited it to “unexpected notifications”.

item.title: The Spy/The Informant [BD/Unseen]
item.dc:creator: Sam17z
item.description:
I feel that this class is boring and would not really contribute any known information to the BD. Most people usually do not get a notification unless it’s from their own abilities and receiving that this person had nothing happen to them just seems boring. Although this is a class to create claim space it just seems like a rushed in class or a class just to add to the amount of classes. I mean watchful eyes is a good counterto poison and bleed but that counter just seems unnecessary it just weakens the cult/Unseen which is not really needed. It may confirm a sheriff, alch, or butler. A,so I feel that the Unseen class needs a buff because usually the Unseen converts are much stronger. Maybe if you include their night ability notification it would be better for the Unseen convert.

item.title: The Spy/The Informant [BD/Unseen]
item.dc:creator: Vulgard
item.description:
Actually, I don’t think that would be the case. With the sheer amount of day abilities in the game, abilities you usually use at different points of the day, it shouldn’t be that easy to detect poison or bleed and point it out without being suspected. Because Spy can be converted, it’s not like you’ll always be trusted. You could be Scorned faking Spy to get a target exed; or you could be converted Spy trying to get a BD exed.

So in the end, no matter the “meta”, I don’t think Spy would cause the Unseen to stop poisoning and the Cult to stop bleeding.

Read full topic

item.title: The Spy/The Informant [BD/Unseen]
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Vulgard:

Even Stoneskin Potion triggers Watchful Eyes.

oh I didn’t say that there were no abilities that don’t trigger Watchful eyes. I was saying poison/bleeding is suicide if there’s a reasonable chance that watchful eyes are up, as the victim is going to announce it, and the spy is really quick going to put the 2 together if he’s watching.

Most likely being combined with a quick alert meta. (IE the second you are poisoned, type p and enter) so that a spy can be closer on timing and not be confused if the stoneskin 10 seconds ago was the poison but took 10 seconds to type poisoned, or if it was the ability used half a second ago.
